questions.question: What is the main difference between listening and hearing?
options: Listening requires attention; hearing does not.
Listening is passive; hearing is active.
Listening involves physical acts; hearing is a mental process.
Listening is always enjoyable; hearing can be boring.

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT one of the benefits of good listening skills?
Which principle of listening emphasizes the importance of creating a comfortable environment for the speaker?
Which of the following factors can impede active listening?
In terms of listening, what does "empathizing" involve?
Which of the following is considered an active listening technique?
What is an effective way to clarify your understanding after someone has finished speaking?
options: Ignore their message and change the subject
Interrupt them with your own thoughts

questions.question: What is "selective listening"?
options: Listening only to what is relevant to the listener
Listening with full attention to every detail

questions.question: Listening requires empathy, while hearing does not.
Listening and hearing are synonymous and can be used interchangeably.
People who actively listen can react more appropriately to situations.
Listening effectively can lead to a stronger social network.
Hearing requires active engagement and focus.
Personal biases and prejudices can enhance active listening.
When someone is speaking, it is helpful to think about your response while they are talking.
Empathy is not necessary for effective listening.
